definition[0]: to praise someone or something too much
example[0]: Tourism on the island is oversold.
definition[1]: to sell more of something than is actually available
definition[2]: to say that something you are selling is better, more useful etc than it really is
example[1]: Vendors tend to oversell the software. That gives people more confidence to work with it than they should have.
definition[3]: to sell more of something than is available
example[2]: They regularly oversold seats on their flights.
